other.description: Each time this model makes a melee attack that targets a unit that is below its Starting Strength, add 1 to the Hit roll. If that target is also Below Half-strength, add 1 to the Wound roll as well.
other.name: Feeding Frenzy

other.description: While a friendly Tyranids unit is within 6" of this model, models in that unit have the Feel No Pain 6+ ability.
other.name: Bio-stimulus (Aura)

datasheets.fluff: These monsters stampede into battle with frightening speed. They devour any prey organism in their paths, but especially favour those victims with psychic abilities. How they metabolise such esoteric powers is unclear, but doing so allows them to project surges of psychocorrosive ash that deflagrate their victimsâ€™ minds and souls.
datasheets.loadout: This model is equipped with: psychoclastic torrent; talons and betentacled maw.
datasheets.name: Psychophage

other.description: Each time an enemy unit is selected to shoot, after that unit has shot, if any models from this unit lost one or more wounds as a result of those attacks, this unit can make a Blistering Assault move. To do so, roll one D6, adding 2 to the result: each model in this unit can be moved a distance in inches up to the result, but this unit must finish that move as close as possible to the closest enemy unit. When doing so, those models can be moved within Engagement Range of that enemy unit. Each unit can only make one Blistering Assault move per phase.
other.name: Blistering Assault

datasheets.fluff: Carnifexes have been a mainstay of the hive fleets for centuries. Rugged and adaptable organisms, they can support a great range of weapon grafts and biomorphs while retaining the raw strength, durability and armoured ferocity that has seen them smash through countless prey defence lines like living battering rams.
datasheets.loadout: Every model is equipped with: Carnifex scything talons; Carnifex extra scything talons; xenos claws and teeth.
datasheets.name: Carnifexes
wargear: Any number of models can each be equipped with 1 bio-plasma.
Any number of models can each be equipped with 1 spine banks.

Any number of models can each have their Carnifex extra scything talons replaced with one of the following: â—¦ 1 deathspitters with slimer maggots â—¦ 1 devourers with brainleech worms â—¦ 1 heavy venom cannon â—¦ 1 stranglethorn cannon â—¦ 1 Carnifex crushing claws

Any number of models can each have their Carnifex scything talons replaced with one of the following: â—¦ 1 deathspitters with slimer maggots â—¦ 1 devourers with brainleech worms â—¦ 1 Carnifex crushing claws

other.description: In your Shooting phase, after this model has shot, select one unit hit by one or more of those attacks. That unit must take a Battle-shock test, subtracting 1 from that test.
other.name: Death Scream

datasheets.fluff: An older adaptation of the basic Carnifex strain, the Screamer-Killer was christened by terrified Imperial troops for the distinctive howl it emits as it generates then unleashes its bio-plasmic blasts. Screamer-Killers are often seen at the forefront of a Tyranid assault, where they can inflict the most damage quickly.
datasheets.loadout: This model is equipped with: bio-plasmic scream; Screamer-Killer talons.
datasheets.name: Screamer-killer

other.description: In your Shooting phase, after this unit has shot, select one enemy unit hit by one or more of those attacks. Until the end of the phase, that enemy unit cannot have the Benefit of Cover.
other.name: Burning Spray

datasheets.fluff: Pyrovores exist to predigest biomass. The acids that drip from their maws are so corrosive they can melt adamantine. Meanwhile, their flame-spewing dorsal organisms can engulf entire squads of prey in roiling chemical fire. Even killing these bioforms is perilous, for their volatile innards can detonate upon death.
datasheets.loadout: Every model is equipped with: flamespurt; chitin-barbed limbs.
datasheets.name: Pyrovores

other.description: One per phase, In your Shooting phase, when one Biovore unit is selected to shoot, it can use this ability instead of making any attacks with its ranged weapons. If it does, you can add a new Spore Mines unit to your army and set it up anywhere on the battlefield that is within 48" of this unit but more than 9" horizontally away from all enemy units. That Spore Mines unit contains 1 model for each model in this unit.
other.name: Seed Spore Mines

datasheets.fluff: These living artillery pieces nurture a clutch of Spore Mines within their bodies. After anchoring themselves to the ground with their chitinous spurs, the creatures fire their living ammunition in high arcs, allowing the Spore Mines to drift languidly down into the midst of the foe where they detonate with sudden violence.
datasheets.loadout: Every model is equipped with: Spore Mine launcher; chitin-barbed limbs.
datasheets.name: Biovores

damaged.description: While this model has 1-10 wounds remaining, each time this model makes an attack, subtract 1 from the Hit roll.

other.description: Each time this model is selected to shoot, you can use this ability. If you do, until the end of the phase, each time this model makes an attack, add 1 to the Wound roll. After resolving those attacks, roll one D6: on a 2+, this model suffers D3 mortal wounds.
other.name: Frenzied Metabolism

datasheets.fluff: Of the winged horrors of the Tyranids, none are as monstrously powerful as the Harridan. Borne on huge membranous wings tipped with bio-cannons, they swoop into enemy lines carving through troops and armour with their scything talons or showering shrieking Gargoyles that had been clinging batlike to the Harridanâ€™s underbelly.
datasheets.loadout: This model is equipped with: 2 dire bio-cannons; gargantuan scything talons.
datasheets.name: Harridan
datasheets.transport: This model has a transport capacity of 20 Gargoyles models and 1 Winged Tyranid Prime model.

damaged.description: While this model has 1-10 wounds remaining, subtract 6 from this modelâ€™s Objective Control characteristic and each time this model makes an attack, subtract 1 from the Hit roll.

other.description: Each time this model makes a Normal, Advance or Fall Back move, it can move over models (excluding Titanic models) and terrain features that are 4" or less in height as if they were not there.
other.name: Stalking Forward

other.description: Each time this model makes an attack that targets a unit that is Battle-shocked, add 1 to the Hit roll.
other.name: Apex-beast

datasheets.fluff: Hierophants are gargantuan specimens of Tyranid adaptation, created to rival the largest war machines and annihilate any resistance. Towering over the battlefield on spined legs that skewer tanks with ease, these apex-beasts spray foes with devastating bio-weapons, their thick chitinous plating making them almost impervious to injury.
datasheets.loadout: This model is equipped with: bio-plasma torrent; 2 dire bio-cannons; lashwhip pods; titanic scything talons.
datasheets.name: Hierophant
datasheets.transport: This model has a transport capacity of 20 Tyranids Infantry models. Each model with a Wounds characteristic of more than 1 takes up the space of 3 models. This model cannot transport models that can Fly.

other.description: At the start of the Fight phase, you can select one enemy unit within 12" of and visible to this model and roll one D6: on a 1, this Psyker suffers D3 mortal wounds; on a 2+, until the end of the phase, subtract 1 from the Attacks characteristic of weapons equipped by models in that unit.
other.name: Paroxysm (Psychic)

other.description: Once per turn, one friendly Tyranids unit within 12" of one or more models with this ability can be targeted with a Stratagem for 0CP, even if another unit from your army has already been targeted with that Stratagem this phase.
other.name: Will of the Hive Mind

datasheets.fluff: When the Hive Mind deploys airborne swarms, it spawns Winged Hive Tyrants to direct them in battle. Wielding an array of nightmarish organic weapons, their monstrous forms singing with the synaptic might of the Hive Mind, these dread swarm-leaders spread terror and death wherever the dark shadow of their wings falls.
datasheets.loadout: This model is equipped with: monstrous bonesword and lash whip; Tyrant talons.
datasheets.name: Winged Hive Tyrant
wargear: This modelâ€™s monstrous bonesword and lash whip can be replaced with one of the following: â—¦ 1 heavy venom cannon â—¦ 1 stranglethorn cannon â—¦ 1 monstrous scything talons

other.description: This model must start the battle in Reserves, but neither it nor any units embarked within it are counted towards any limits placed on the maximum number of Reserves units you can start the battle with. This model can be set up in the Reinforcements step of your first, second or third Movement phase, regardless of any mission rules. Any units embarked within this model must immediately disembark after it has been set up on the battlefield, and they must be set up more than 9" away from all enemy models. After this model has been set up on the battlefield, no units can embark within it.
other.name: Aerial Seeding

datasheets.fluff: Tyrannocytes are huge spores, heat-resistant to endure atmospheric re-entry and with wet, pulsing interior chambers within which broods of organisms can ride down to a worldâ€™s surface. Once its passengers spill forth into battle, the Tyrannocyte drifts skyward again and goes hunting for its own prey.
datasheets.loadout: This model is equipped with: Tyrannocyte bio-weapons; flensing whips.
datasheets.name: Tyrannocyte
datasheets.transport: This model has a transport capacity of 20 Tyranids Infantry models, or 1 Tyranids Monster model with a Wounds characteristic of 12 or less. Each Infantry model with a Wounds characteristic of more than 1 takes up the space of 3 models.

damaged.description: While this model has 1-4 wounds remaining, each time this model makes an attack, subtract 1 from the Hit roll.

other.description: Each time this model ends a Normal move, you can do one of the following: â–   Select one enemy unit it moved over during that move and roll six D6: for each 3+, that unit suffers 1 mortal wound. â–   Once per phase, in your Movement phase, add a new Spore Mines unit containing D3 models to your army and set it up anywhere on the battlefield that is within 6" of this model and more than 9" horizontally away from all enemy units.
other.name: Spore Mine Cysts

datasheets.fluff: Harpies are flying bioforms whose natural agility allows them to outmanoeuvre most prey fighter craft. They are often sent in amidst the first waves of an invasion, dropping organic munitions onto panicked defenders and diving down to attack.
datasheets.loadout: This model is equipped with: stinger salvoes; twin stranglethorn cannon; scything wings.
datasheets.name: Harpy
wargear: This modelâ€™s twin stranglethorn cannon can be replaced with 1 twin heavy venom cannon.

damaged.description: While this model has 1-4 wounds remaining, each time this model makes an attack, subtract 1 from the Hit roll.

other.description: Each time this model makes a ranged attack that targets a unit that can Fly, add 1 to the Hit roll.
other.name: Airborne Predator

datasheets.fluff: Hive Crones scour the skies for prey fighter craft. The tentaclids they release pursue enemy aircraft before erupting in bio-electric pulses that banish motive force and send the dark, dead machines tumbling groundward. Then, drool cannons slathering, the Hive Crones dive down to seek fresh, land-based prey.
datasheets.loadout: This model is equipped with: drool cannon; stinger salvoes; tentaclids; scything wings; thorax spur.
datasheets.name: Hive Crone

other.description: At the start of your Command phase, if this model is on the battlefield, you gain 1CP.
other.name: Hive Commander

other.description: Once per battle, after your opponent uses a Stratagem, if this model is your Warlord and is on the battlefield, it can use this ability. If it does, until the end of the battle, increase that Stratagemâ€™s cost to your opponent by 1CP.
other.name: Malign Presence

other.description: While a friendly Tyranids unit is within 9" of this model, that unit is within your armyâ€™s Synapse Range.
other.name: Domination of the Hive Mind

datasheets.fluff: The Swarmlord is the herald of the Hive Mind and may be as old as the Tyranid race itself. Upon death, the beast is always absorbed through the synaptic link and spawned anew. It has presided over the annihilation of countless civilisations, and with every incarnation it only becomes more deadly.
datasheets.leader: This model can be attached to the following unit: â–  Tyrant Guard
datasheets.loadout: This model is equipped with: synaptic pulse; bone sabres.
datasheets.name: The Swarmlord

other.description: Once per turn, one friendly Tyranids unit within 12" of one or more models with this ability can be targeted with a Stratagem for 0CP, even if another unit from your army has already been targeted with that Stratagem this phase.
other.name: Will of the Hive Mind

other.description: While a friendly Tyranids unit is within 6" of this model, ranged weapons equipped by models in that unit have the [ASSAULT] ability.
other.name: Onslaught (Aura, Psychic)

datasheets.fluff: Hive Tyrants command the swarm on the Hive Mindâ€™s behalf. Not only are they powerful warrior organisms in their own right, but they are also possessed of a depth of sentient autonomy and strategic cunning that makes them truly deadly foes. Where the Hive Tyrants bestride the battlefield, death comes for the prey.
datasheets.leader: This model can be attached to the following unit: â–  Tyrant Guard
datasheets.loadout: This model is equipped with: monstrous bonesword and lash whip; monstrous scything talons.
datasheets.name: Hive Tyrant
wargear: This modelâ€™s monstrous bonesword and lash whip can be replaced with one of the following: â—¦ 1 heavy venom cannon â—¦ 1 stranglethorn cannon â—¦ 1 monstrous scything talons

This modelâ€™s monstrous scything talons can be replaced with one of the following: â—¦ 1 heavy venom cannon* â—¦ 1 stranglethorn cannon* *  This model cannot be equipped with both a stranglethorn cannon and a heavy venom cannon. This model cannot be equipped with more than 1 heavy venom cannon, and it cannot be equipped with more than 1 stranglethorn cannon.

other.description: In your Shooting phase, each time this model is selected to shoot, it can use this ability instead of making any attacks with its ranged weapons. If it does, you can add a new Mucolid Spores unit containing 1 model to your army and set it up anywhere on the battlefield that is within 18" of this model but more than 9" horizontally away from all enemy units.
other.name: Seed Mucolids

datasheets.fluff: Dropped from orbit, Sporocysts dig into the surface of the prey world like ticks then begin spewing toxic spores from their living chimneys. They are able to eject shoals of Mucolid Spores, while prey who stray too close are subjected to hails of organic projectiles from the bio-cannons grafted to the Sporocystâ€™s hide.
datasheets.loadout: This model is equipped with: Sporocyst bio-weapons; flensing whips.
datasheets.name: Sporocyst

abilities.description: Each time an enemy unit is set up or ends a Normal, Advance or Fall Back move within range of this weapon, if that enemy unit is an eligible target, the bearer can shoot with this weapon at that unit as if it were your Shooting phase (the bearer can do so up to four times per phase).
abilities.name: Hive Defences

damaged.description: While this model has 1-5 wounds remaining, each time this model makes an attack, subtract 1 from the Hit roll.

other.description: While an enemy unit is within 6" of this model, each time a model in that unit makes an attack, subtract 1 from the Hit roll, and, if that enemy unit is Below Half-strength, subtract 1 from the Wound roll as well.
other.name: Encephalic Diffusion (Aura, Psychic)

datasheets.fluff: Amongst the most powerful Tyranid psyker-analogues yet known, Maleceptors wield colossal synaptic power. Ethereal psychic pseudopods lash about them, able to literally detonate victimsâ€™ skulls with the slightest touch, while the encephalitic orbs set into their carapaces focus the smothering dread of the Shadow in the Warp.
datasheets.loadout: This model is equipped with: psychic overload; massive scything talons.
datasheets.name: Maleceptor

damaged.description: While this model has 1-5 wounds remaining, each time this model makes an attack, subtract 1 from the Hit roll.

other.description: At the end of your Movement phase, roll one D6 for each enemy unit within 6" of this model: on a 2-3, that unit suffers 1 mortal wound; on a 4-5, that unit suffers D3 mortal wounds; on a 6, that unit suffers D6 mortal wounds.
other.name: Hypertoxic Miasma (Aura)

other.description: Each time an enemy unit (excluding Titanic units) within Engagement Range of one or more units from your army with this ability is selected to Fall Back, you can roll one D6: on a 3+, that enemy unit must Remain Stationary instead.
other.name: Grasping Tendrils

datasheets.fluff: The semi-sentient spores spewed by the Toxicrene can penetrate even sealed armour and enviro-suits before multiplying within the victimâ€™s body to burst their organs and dissolve their flesh. Prey not slain in this horrible manner soon fall to the Toxicreneâ€™s monstrous bulk and vast, lashing tendrils as it rampages ever onwards.
datasheets.loadout: This model is equipped with: massive toxic lashes.
datasheets.name: Toxicrene

damaged.description: While this model has 1-5 wounds remaining, each time this model makes an attack, subtract 1 from the Hit roll.

other.description: Each time this model is selected to fight, after resolving its attacks, if one or more enemy units were destroyed by those attacks, each enemy unit within 6" of this model must take a Battle-shock test.
other.name: Grisly Spectacle

datasheets.fluff: The infinite hunger of the Haruspex can see it consume an entire platoon of prey organisms in moments. Nothing escapes its yawning gullet and lashing tongue for long; its victims meet a horrible end as they are swallowed down to be gradually dissolved into raw biomass within the monsterâ€™s churning innards.
datasheets.loadout: This model is equipped with: grasping tongue; ravenous maw; shovelling claws.
datasheets.name: Haruspex

damaged.description: While this model has 1-5 wounds remaining, each time this model makes an attack, subtract 1 from the Hit roll.

other.description: In your Shooting phase, after this model has shot, select one enemy unit hit by one or more of those attacks. Until the end of the phase, each time a friendly Tyranids model makes an attack that targets that unit, re-roll a Hit roll of 1.
other.name: Symbiotic Targeting

datasheets.fluff: Huge, tough and very stupid, the Exocrineâ€™s only task is to carry the dorsal cannon organism on its back into an optimal firing position. Once in place, the bio-plasmic cannon emits a terrible, high-pitched hiss before unleashing a searing blast of bio-plasma capable of reducing tanks and bunkers to glowing craters.
datasheets.loadout: This model is equipped with: bio-plasmic cannon; powerful limbs.
datasheets.name: Exocrine

damaged.description: While 1-5 wounds remaining, subtract 1 from the Hit roll.

other.description:
At the start of the first battle round, select one of the following:

- Select one enemy unit. Until the end of the battle, each time this model makes an attack that targets that unit, you can re-roll the Hit roll and you can re-roll the Wound roll.
- Select one objective marker. Until the end of the battle, while this model is within range of that objective marker, it has the Feel No Pain 5+ ability, and an Objective Control characteristic of 15.
other.name: Singular Purpouse

other.description: This model has the Feel No Pain 4+  ability against mortal wounds.
other.name: Unnatural Resilience

datasheets.fluff: Lictors are an adaptation of the Tyranid Warrior bioform specialising in infiltration, scouting and assassination. Hidden by their chameleonic skin, Lictors pick off their prey opportunistically, always looking for a chance to crack open their victimsâ€™ skulls and suck out the secrets held within using their feeder tendrils.
datasheets.loadout: This model is equipped with: Psychic Tendril; Monstrous scything talons; Monstrous rending claws
datasheets.name: Norn Emisary

damaged.description: While this model has 1-5 wounds remaining, each time this model makes an attack, subtract 1 from the Hit roll.

other.description:
At the start of the first battle round, select one of the following:

- Select one enemy unit. Until the end of the battle, each time this model makes an attack that targets that unit, you can re-roll the Hit roll and you can re-roll the Wound roll.
- Select one objective marker. Until the end of the battle, while this model is within range of that objective marker, it has the Feel No Pain 5+ ability, and an Objective Control characteristic of 15.
other.name: Singular Purpouse

other.description: Once per turn, when an enemy unit within Engagement Range of this model is selected to Fall Back, roll one D6: on a 2+, that unit suffers D6 mortal wounds.
other.name: Harpoon Barbs

datasheets.fluff: Lictors are an adaptation of the Tyranid Warrior bioform specialising in infiltration, scouting and assassination. Hidden by their chameleonic skin, Lictors pick off their prey opportunistically, always looking for a chance to crack open their victimsâ€™ skulls and suck out the secrets held within using their feeder tendrils.
datasheets.loadout: This model is equipped with: Toxinjector harpoon; Monstrous scything talons
datasheets.name: Norn Assimilator

profiles.name: Harpooned: After the bearer has shot with this weapon, select one enemy Monster or Vehicle unit hit by one or more of those attacks. Until the end of the turn, each time the bearer selects that unit as a target of a charge, add 2 to the Charge roll.

damaged.description: While this model has 1-5 wounds remaining, each time this model makes an attack, subtract 1 from the Hit roll.

other.description: In your Command phase, you can select one friendly Termagants unit within 6" of this model and return up to D3+3 destroyed Termagant models to that unit. A Termagants unit cannot be selected for this ability more than once per phase.
other.name: Spawn Termagants

other.description: While a friendly Termagants unit is within 6" of this model, ranged weapons equipped by models in that unit have the [LETHAL HITS] ability.
other.name: Brood Progenitor (Aura, Psychic)

datasheets.fluff: Beyond simply being large and powerful synapse beasts, Tervigons are also able to spawn skittering masses of Termagant warrior organisms from within their bulging abdomens. These dripping spawn instinctively protect their broodmother with their lives, their numbers growing all the time until they overwhelm the prey.
datasheets.loadout: This model is equipped with: stinger salvoes; massive scything talons.
datasheets.name: Tervigon
wargear: This modelâ€™s massive scything talons can be replaced with 1 massive crushing claws.

damaged.description: While this model has 1-5 wounds remaining, each time this model makes an attack, subtract 1 from the Hit roll.

other.description: Once per battle, when an attack is allocated to this model, you change the Damage characteristic of that attack to 0.
other.name: Resilient Organism

datasheets.fluff: The Tyrannofex is a walking battle tank and heavy weapons platform of huge size and resilience. These warrior organisms are extremely well armoured, more than capable of going toe-to-toe with the heaviest battle tanks of their prey species in a shooting match. Few foes can stand against even one of these beasts.
datasheets.loadout: This model is equipped with: fleshborer hive; stinger salvoes; powerful limbs.
datasheets.name: Tyrannofex
wargear: This modelâ€™s fleshborer hive can be replaced with one of the following: â—¦ 1 acid spray â—¦ 1 rupture cannon

damaged.description: While this model has 1-5 wounds remaining, each time this model makes an attack, subtract 1 from the Hit roll.

other.description: Each time this model fights, after it has resolved its attacks, if one or more enemy models (excluding Vehicle models) were destroyed as the result of those attacks, this model regains up to D3 wounds.
other.name: Digestion Spine

datasheets.loadout: This model is equipped with: massive scything sickle-talons.
datasheets.name: Dimachaeron

damaged.description: While this model has 1-6 wounds remaining, each time this model makes an attack, subtract 1 from the Hit roll.

other.description: In your Shooting phase, after this model has shot, select one enemy unit (excluding Titanic units) that was hit by one or more of those attacks. Until the start of your next turn, while this model is on the battlefield, that enemy unit is suppressed. While a unit is suppressed, each time a model in that unit makes an attack, subtract 1 from the Hit roll.
other.name: Overgrown Barbs

datasheets.fluff: First recorded during the invasion of Hammanâ€™s World, these looming monstrosities are protected by thick armour plates that allow them to shrug off all but the most devastating of attacks, while their bio-cannons are able to hold off the foe as they charge forward to finish the prey at close quarters.
datasheets.loadout: This model is equipped with: 2 bio-cannons; Hierodule scything talons.
datasheets.name: Barbed Hierodule

damaged.description: While this model has 1-6 wounds remaining, each time this model makes an attack, subtract 1 from the Hit roll.

other.description: This model is eligible to declare a charge in a turn in which it Fell Back.
other.name: Irresistible Force

datasheets.fluff: The Hive Mind trusts only in the power of flesh. The Hierodule is a clear embodiment of this principle, a living weapon of monstrous power whose scythed limbs can cut apart war machines with ease. Any that survive the power of its talons are subjected to torrents of mutagenic acid from the symbiote-beast that grows between its armoured plates.
datasheets.loadout: This model is equipped with: bio-acid spray; Hierodule scything talons.
datasheets.name: Scythed Hierodule

other.description: If this model is destroyed by a melee attack, if it has not fought this phase, roll one D6: on a 4+, do not remove it from play. The destroyed model can fight after the attacking modelâ€™s unit has finished making its attacks, and is then removed from play.
other.name: Death Blow

other.description: While this model is leading a unit, weapons equipped by models in that unit have the [SUSTAINED HITS 1] ability.
other.name: Alpha Warrior

datasheets.fluff: Tyranid Primes adapted for flight possess all the physical and synaptic might of an alpha war-beast, while also boasting the frightening speed and manoeuvrability imparted by huge leathery wings. Swooping down into the midst of the foe, they rend and tear until nought remains but corpses and fleeing prey.
datasheets.leader: This model can be attached to the following units: â–  Gargoyles â–  Tyranid Warriors with melee Bio-weapons â–  Tyranid Warriors with Ranged Bio-weapons
datasheets.loadout: This model is equipped with: Prime talons.
datasheets.name: Winged Tyranid Prime

other.description: At the start of the Fight phase, select one enemy unit within Engagement Range of this model. That enemy unit must take a Battle-shock test.
other.name: It Itches!

other.description: Each time an Infantry model is destroyed by an attack made with this modelâ€™s barbed ovipositor, after this model has finished making its attacks, you can add one new Ripper Swarms unit to your army consisting of D3 models and set it up within 3" of this model. If you do, that Ripper Swarms unit can be set up within Engagement Range of the destroyed modelâ€™s unit (but not within Engagement Range of any other enemy units).
other.name: Parasitic Infection

datasheets.fluff: Swooping on leathery wings, Parasites of Mortrex use their barbed ovipositors to drive Ripper gestation pods deep into their victimsâ€™ bodies, from where the swiftly growing creatures soon eat their way out. Such was the doom of the defenders of Mortrex, the world first cursed by the Parasitesâ€™ onslaught.
datasheets.loadout: This model is equipped with: barbed ovipositor; clawed limbs.
datasheets.name: Parasite Of Mortrex

other.description: At the end of your opponentâ€™s turn, if this unit is not within Engagement Range of one or more enemy units, you can remove it from the battlefield and place it into Strategic Reserves.
other.name: Death From Below

wargear.description: Change the Save Characteristic of this model to 4+.
wargear.name: Armored Thorax

datasheets.fluff: Serpentine bioforms capable of a terrifying turn of speed, Raveners are made doubly dangerous by their ability to tunnel swiftly through even solid bedrock. Often assaulting their prey from below, Raveners are especially vicious and predatory warrior organisms used as shock troops by the Hive Mind.
datasheets.loadout: Every model is equipped with: Ravener claws and talons.
datasheets.name: Raveners
wargear: Any number of models can each be equipped with an armored thorax, or 1 thoracic bio-weapon.

other.description: Each time an enemy unit ends a move within 3" of a model in this unit, and each time a model in this unit ends a move within 3" of an enemy unit, roll one D6: on a 2-5, that enemy unit suffers 1 mortal wound; on a 6, that enemy unit suffers D3 mortal wounds. The model in this unit that caused that roll is then destroyed.
other.name: Floating Death

other.description: Enemy units cannot start or end an Advance move within 6" of this unit.
other.name: Bio-minefield

datasheets.fluff: Spore Mines are a form of living mine or bomb, which drift across the battlefield in shoals and detonate when they detect prey organisms nearby. Those caught in the blast are torn apart as surely as if they had caught a brace of live frag grenades. The Hive Mind often uses Spore Mines to deny areas of the battlefield to the prey.
datasheets.loadout: Every model is equipped with: nothing.
datasheets.name: Spore Mines

other.description: Each time an enemy unit ends a move within 3" of a model in this unit, and each time a model in this unit ends a move within 3" of an enemy unit, roll one D6: on a 2-5, that enemy unit suffers D3 mortal wounds; on a 6, that enemy unit suffers D6 mortal wounds. The model in this unit that caused that roll is then destroyed.
other.name: Floating Death

other.description: Enemy units cannot start or end an Advance move within 6" of this unit.
other.name: Bio-minefield

datasheets.fluff: These rudimentary organisms are filled with poisonous gases held under extremely high pressure. Instinct drives them to drift towards prey formations or up into the path of enemy aircraft, before detonating in a nauseating spray of poisonous filth and chitinous shrapnel.
datasheets.loadout: Every model is equipped with: nothing.
datasheets.name: Mucolid Spores

other.description: In your Shooting phase, after this unit has shot, if it is not within Engagement Range of any enemy units, it can make a Normal move of up to 6". If it does, until the end of the turn, this unit is not eligible to declare a charge.
other.name: Winged Swarm

datasheets.fluff: Gargoyles are often the first warrior organisms hurled against a prey world. Their teeming swarms darken the skies. Their opportunistic attacks spread panic and disarray. Worst of all, the creatures can squirm through gaps that appear far too small, bursting through gun slits and vent pipes to assail horrified defenders.
datasheets.loadout: Every model is equipped with: fleshborer; blinding venom.
datasheets.name: Gargoyles

other.description: While an enemy unit is within Engagement Range of one or more units with this ability, halve the Objective Control characteristic of models in that enemy unit.
other.name: Chitinous Horrors

datasheets.loadout: Every model is equipped with: claws and teeth.
datasheets.name: Sky-slasher Swarms
wargear: Any number of models can each be equipped with 1 spinemaws.

other.description: While an enemy unit is within Engagement Range of this unit, halve the Objective Control characteristic of models in that enemy unit.
other.name: Chitinous Horrors (Aura)

datasheets.fluff: Living carpets of Rippers squirm across the ground wherever the Tyranid swarms advance. Little more than simple eating machines, these chitinous horrors swarm over the wounded and dead alike, and can even drag down trained warriors in sufficient numbers. Once a Ripperâ€™s fangs sink home, it will not let goâ€¦
datasheets.loadout: Every model is equipped with: xenos claws and teeth.
datasheets.name: Ripper Swarms
wargear: All models in this unit can each be equipped with 1 spinemaws.

damaged.description: While this model has 1-5 wounds remaining, each time this model makes an attack, subtract 1 from the Hit roll.

other.description: Each time this model is set up on the battlefield using the Deep Strike ability, it can be set up anywhere on the battlefield that is more than 3" horizontally away from all enemy units. When doing so, if this model is set up within 9" of one or more enemy units, until the end of the turn, it is not eligible to declare a charge.
other.name: Subterranean Tunnels

datasheets.fluff: Trygons are battle-tank-sized living tunnelling machines. As they dig through the substrata of the prey world, they excavate huge tunnels for other Tyranid beasts to exploit. At the same time, the rasping of their chitinous plates builds up a powerful bio-electric charge that the Trygons can unleash as a weapon.
datasheets.loadout: This model is equipped with: bio-electric pulse; Trygon scything talons.
datasheets.name: Trygon

damaged.description: While this model has 1-5 wounds remaining, each time this model makes an attack, subtract 1 from the Hit roll.

other.description: Each time this unit is set up on the battlefield using the Deep Strike ability, roll one D6 for each enemy unit within 12" of this model: on a 2-4, that unit suffers D3 mortal wounds; on a 5+, that unit suffers 3 mortal wounds and must take a Battle-shock test.
other.name: Terror From The Deep

datasheets.fluff: Vast, burrowing wormforms, Mawlocs hunt by sensing even the smallest vibrations on the surface above them. Once they have located prey, the Mawlocs surge upwards in an eruption of bedrock and soil, yawning maws swallowing everything above them before they plunge back under the surface again.
datasheets.loadout: This model is equipped with: distensible jaw; Mawloc scything talons.
datasheets.name: Mawloc

other.description: At the start of each playerâ€™s Command phase, this model regains up to D3 lost wounds.
other.name: Unstoppable Monster

other.description: While this model is leading a unit, each time a model in that unit makes an attack, you can re-roll the Hit roll.
other.name: Alpha Leader

composition: 1 Old One Eye â€“ Epic Hero
datasheets.fluff: Known as the Beast of Calth, this unstoppable brute was first seen during the First Tyrannic War. Though many have thought it slain over the centuries, always the scarred monster rises again. Whether it is a Tyranid subgenus or the same unstoppable monster come again is a mystery few in its path live long enough to ponder.
datasheets.leader: This model can be attached to the following unit: â–  Carnifexes
datasheets.loadout: This model is equipped with: Old One Eyeâ€™s claws and talons.

profiles.name: Old One Eyeâ€™s claws and talons â€“ sweep
Old One Eyeâ€™s claws and talons â€“ strike

datasheets.name: Old One Eye

other.description: Each time this model destroys an enemy Character model, you gain 1CP.
other.name: Feeder Tendrils

other.description: Once per battle round, you can target one model with this ability with the Rapid Ingress Stratagem for 0CP.
other.name: Pheromone Trail

datasheets.fluff: Lictors are an adaptation of the Tyranid Warrior bioform specialising in infiltration, scouting and assassination. Hidden by their chameleonic skin, Lictors pick off their prey opportunistically, always looking for a chance to crack open their victimsâ€™ skulls and suck out the secrets held within using their feeder tendrils.
datasheets.loadout: This model is equipped with: Lictor claws and talons.
datasheets.name: Lictor

other.description: Each time this model destroys an enemy Character model, you gain 1CP.
other.name: Feeder Tendrils

other.description: While an enemy unit is within 6" of this model, worsen the Leadership characteristic of models in that unit by 1. In addition, in the Battle-shock step of your opponentâ€™s Command phase, if such an enemy unit is below its Starting Strength, it must take a Battle-shock test.
other.name: Fear of the Unseen (Aura)

special.description: This model cannot be your Warlord.
special.name: HUNTER ORGANISM

datasheets.fluff: The Deathleaper is an advancement of the Lictor strain intended to act as a terror weapon. Possessing an instinctive understanding of how to spread fear through prey populations, it uses its skills in stealth, infiltration and assassination to sow paranoia and dread before the hive fleet attacks en masse.
datasheets.loadout: This model is equipped with: Lictor claws and talons.
datasheets.name: Deathleaper

other.description: You can target this unit with the Heroic Intervention Stratagem for 0CP, and can do so even if you have already used that Stratagem on a different unit this phase.
other.name: Pouncing Leap

datasheets.fluff: Stealthy hunters and expert ambushers, Von Ryanâ€™s Leapers are swift, agile and especially lethal when fighting in dense terrain. Akin to living mines, they lie still at the optimum locations to cause as much damage as possible. When they sense the perfect time to strike, they butcher all around in a murderous frenzy.
datasheets.loadout: Every model is equipped with: Leaperâ€™s talons.
datasheets.name: Von Ryanâ€™s Leapers

other.description: Each time this model destroys an enemy Character model, you gain 1CP.
other.name: Feeder Tendrils

other.description: In your Command phase, select one enemy unit within 12" of this model. That unit must take a Battle-shock Test.
other.name: Neural Disruption

other.description:
While an enemy unit is within 12" of this model, if that unit is Battle-shocked: 

- Each time a model in that unit makes an attack, substract 1 from the Hit rol.
- Each time a friendly Tyranids model makes an attack that targets that unit, add 1 to the wound roll.
other.name: Psychological Sabouteur (Aura)

datasheets.fluff: Lictors are an adaptation of the Tyranid Warrior bioform specialising in infiltration, scouting and assassination. Hidden by their chameleonic skin, Lictors pick off their prey opportunistically, always looking for a chance to crack open their victimsâ€™ skulls and suck out the secrets held within using their feeder tendrils.
datasheets.loadout: This model is equipped with: Piercing claws and talons.
datasheets.name: Neurolictor

other.description: At the start of the Fight phase, select one enemy unit within Engagement Range of this model. Until the end of the phase, each time a model in that unit makes an attack, subtract 1 from the Hit roll.
other.name: Hypnotic Gaze (Psychic)

other.description: While this model is leading a unit, weapons equipped by models in that unit have the [DEVASTATING WOUNDS] ability.
other.name: Vicious Insight

datasheets.fluff: Mightiest and most intelligent of the Genestealer bioforms, the Broodlord is an insidious predatory infiltrator. Able to act as a forward commander for the invasion swarms, it sows carnage through the enemy lines while maximising the cunning and lethality of lesser warrior organisms around it.
datasheets.leader: This model can be attached to the following unit: â–  Genestealers
datasheets.loadout: This model is equipped with: Broodlord claws and talons.
datasheets.name: Broodlord

other.description: Each time this model's unit is selected to fight, select one of the following abilities to apply to all melee weapons equipped by models in that unit until the end of the phase: â–  [SUSTAINED HITS 1] â–  [LANCE] â–  [LETHAL HITS]
other.name: Prey Adaptation

other.description: While this model is leading a unit, the range of that unit's Foul Spores Aura ability is increased to 9".
other.name: Enhanced Toxic Miasma

datasheets.leader: This model can be attached to the following unit: â–  Venomthropes
datasheets.loadout: This model is equipped with: grasping tail.
datasheets.name: Malanthrope

other.description: If one or more Neurotyrants from your army are on the battlefield when you unleash the Shadow in the Warp, subtract 1 from the Battle-shock test each enemy unit on the battlefield must take as a result.
other.name: Psychic Terror (Psychic)

other.description: In your Command phase, you can select up to two friendly Tyranids units within 18" of this modelâ€™s unit. Until the start of your next Command phase, the selected units are always considered to be within Synapse Range of your army. Designerâ€™s Note: Place a Synaptic Relay token next to each selected unit to remind you.
other.name: Neuroloids

other.description: While this model is leading a unit, each time a model in that unit makes an attack, add 1 to the Hit roll. If the target is Battle-shocked, add 1 to the Wound roll as well.
other.name: Node Lash (Psychic)

datasheets.fluff: The Shadow in the Warp radiating from this immensely powerful psyker-analogue creeps in all directions, driving even non-psychic prey organisms to screaming madness. As its foes writhe in agony, the Neurotyrant guides the swarms around it to slaughter with brutal efficiency.
datasheets.leader: This model can be attached to the following units: â–  Neurogaunts â–  Tyrant Guard
datasheets.loadout: This model is equipped with: psychic scream; Neurotyrant claws and lashes.
datasheets.name: Neurotyrant

other.description: Each time a model in this unit makes an attack, you can re-roll a Hit roll of 1. If the target is within range of an objective marker, each time a model in this unit makes an attack, you can re-roll the Wound rolls of 1.
other.name: Vanguard Predator

datasheets.fluff: Swift vanguard organisms armoured in chitin and possessed of terrifying strength and agility, Genestealers are peerless predators. Their broods move ahead of the hive fleets to seek out fresh feeding grounds. Then, when the invasion swarms descend, the Genestealers burst from hiding to begin the slaughter.
datasheets.loadout: Every model is equipped with: Genestealer claws and talons.
datasheets.name: Genestealers

other.description: While a friendly Tyranids unit is within 6" of this unit, each time a ranged attack targets that unit, models in that unit have the Benefit of Cover against that attack. In addition, while a friendly Tyranids unit (excluding Monsters) is within 6" of this unit, models in that unit have the Stealth ability.
other.name: Foul Spores (Aura)

datasheets.fluff: Venomthropes drift forward amidst miasmal clouds of spores that spew from within their bodies. The touch of their tendrils is extremely poisonous, and those exposed to the Venomthropesâ€™ spore clouds for any length of time drown on their own frothing fluids as they dissolve from the inside out.
datasheets.loadout: Every model is equipped with: toxic lashes.
datasheets.name: Venomthropes

other.description: At the start of the Fight phase, you can select one of the following abilities to apply to models in this unit until the end of the phase: â–   Aggression Imperative: Each time a model in this unit makes a melee attack, re-roll a Hit roll of 1. â–   Preservation Imperative: Each time a saving throw is made for a model in this unit, re-roll a saving throw of 1.
other.name: Adrenalised Onslaught

datasheets.fluff: Strong, swift, independently intelligent and amongst the Hive Mindâ€™s most adaptable bioforms, Tyranid Warriors are the backbone of many Tyranid invasions. Their synaptic link imbues them with advanced martial abilities, and also allows them to serve as synaptic linchpins within the wider swarms during battle.
datasheets.loadout: Every model is equipped with: bio-weapons.
datasheets.name: Tyranid Warriors With Melee Bio-weapons

other.description: This unit is eligible to shoot and declare a charge in a turn in which it Fell Back.
other.name: Adaptable Predators

datasheets.fluff: Strong, swift, independently intelligent and amongst the Hive Mindâ€™s most adaptable bioforms, Tyranid Warriors are the backbone of many Tyranid invasions. Their synaptic link imbues them with advanced martial abilities, and also allows them to serve as synaptic linchpins within the wider swarms during battle.
datasheets.loadout: Every model is equipped with: devourer; bio-weapons.
datasheets.name: Tyranid Warriors With Ranged Bio-weapons
wargear: Any number of models can each have their devourer replaced with one of the following: â—¦ 1 deathspitter â—¦ 1 spinefists
For every 3 models in this unit, 1 modelâ€™s devourer can be replaced with 1 barbed strangler.
For every 3 models in this unit, 1 modelâ€™s devourer can be replaced with 1 venom cannon.

other.description: While a friendly Tyranids unit is within 6" of this unit, models in that unit have a 6+ invulnerable save.
other.name: Warp Field (Aura, Psychic)

other.description: While this unit contains a Neurothrope, while an enemy unit is within 6" of this unit, each time that enemy unit fails a Battle-shock test, it suffers D3 mortal wounds and one model in this unit regains up to D3 lost wounds.
other.name: Spirit Leech (Aura, Psychic)

datasheets.fluff: A Zoanthropeâ€™s physical form is given over to harnessing the might of the Hive Mind. Not only do they act as synapse nodes, but they can also draw upon the energies of the Hive Mind to unleash searing psychic blasts, and to generate fields of defensive power that can stop an artillery shell dead.
datasheets.loadout: Every model is equipped with: Warp Blast; xenos claws and teeth.
datasheets.name: Zoanthropes

other.description: Each time you target this unit with the Fire Overwatch Stratagem, while resolving that Stratagem, hits are scored on unmodified Hit rolls of 5+, or unmodified Hit rolls of 4+ instead if this unit is within range of an objective marker.
other.name: Defensive Stance

datasheets.fluff: Hive Guard are spawned to protect Tyranid bio-architecture and vital spore-seeding sites. They carry a monstrous arsenal of grafted bio-weapons and are instinctively driven â€“ or sometimes synaptically impelled â€“ to lay down heavy hails of firepower against those prey organisms the Hive Mind wishes to see eradicated.
datasheets.loadout: Every model is equipped with: shockcannon; xenos claws and teeth.
datasheets.name: Hive Guard
wargear: Any number of models can each have their shockcannon replaced with 1 impaler cannon.

other.description: In your Shooting phase, after this unit has shot, select one enemy Infantry unit hit by one or more of those attacks, until the end of your opponentâ€™s next turn, that enemy unit is disrupted. While a unit is disrupted, subtract 2 from its Move characteristic, and subtract 2 from Advance and Charge rolls made for it.
other.name: Disruption Bombardment

datasheets.fluff: Barbgaunts are little more than living weapons, their bodies and bio-cannons slaved to the will of a pulsating ganglio-parasite that piggybacks them into battle. There, they unleash volleys of chitinous barbs that detonate with the fury of violent muscle-spasms and transfix nearby victims with hails of jagged projectiles.
datasheets.loadout: Every model is equipped with: bio-cannon; xenos claws and teeth.
datasheets.name: Barbgaunts

other.description: Once per turn, when an enemy unit ends a Normal, Advance or Fall Back move within 9" of this unit, if this unit is not within Engagement Range of one or more enemy units, it can make a Normal move of up to D6".
other.name: Skulking Horrors

datasheets.fluff: Scuttling predators that attack in huge swarms, Termagants were originally spawned to roam the tight arterial passages of hive ships and hunt intruders. They harry their prey with a hail of firepower, seeking always to outflank and envelop their victims as they erode their numbers.
datasheets.loadout: Every model is equipped with: fleshborer; xenos claws and teeth.
datasheets.name: Termagants
wargear: All models in this unit can each have their fleshborer replaced with 1 Termagant devourer.
All models in this unit can each have their fleshborer replaced with 1 Termagant spinefists.
For every 10 models in this unit, 1 Termagant fleshborer can be replaced with 1 Shardlauncher.
For every 10 models in this unit, 1 Termagant fleshborer can be replaced with 1 Spike rifle.
For every 10 models in this unit, 1 Termagant fleshborer can be replaced with 1 Strangleweb.

other.description: This unit is eligible to declare a charge in a turn in which it Advanced.
other.name: Bounding Leap

datasheets.fluff: Swarming shock troops, Hormagaunts are seeded onto prey worlds in their billions. As simple hunter-slayer organisms, they can be left to rampage, wearing down defence lines and forcing the prey to expend lives and ammunition. Many formidable bastions have been buried in literal mountains of these chitinous horrors.
datasheets.loadout: Every model is equipped with: Hormagaunt talons.
datasheets.name: Hormagaunts

other.description: While a Character model is leading this unit, that Character has the Feel No Pain 5+ ability.
other.name: Guardian Organism

datasheets.fluff: Incredibly well armoured and resilient, Tyrant Guard form a mobile bulwark around their assigned synapse organism. So extreme is their bio-adaptation, they do not even possess weak spots such as eyes. Instead, they are guided as extensions of their chargeâ€™s synaptic will, acting as living weapons and shields.
datasheets.loadout: Every model is equipped with: scything talons and rending claws.

profiles.name: Bone cleaver, lash whip and rending claws

datasheets.name: Tyrant Guard
wargear: Any number of models can each have their scything talons and rending claws replaced with one of the following: â—¦ 1 bone cleaver, lash whip and rending claws â—¦ 1 crushing claws and rending claws

other.description: While this unit is within Synapse Range of your army, it has the Synapse keyword.
other.name: Neurocytes

datasheets.fluff: Neurogaunts scuttle forward in seething masses, driven on by the parasitic neurocytes that cling to their backs. Their primary purpose is to protect the synaptic node beasts coordinating invasion swarms. It is a task they go about with single-minded savagery, slashing, biting and giving their lives without an instantâ€™s hesitation.
datasheets.loadout: Every model is equipped with: xenos claws and teeth. * This unit can only contain 2 Neurogaunt Nodebeasts if it contains 20 Neurogaunts.
datasheets.name: Neurogaunts

enhancements.description: Tyranids model only. While a friendly Tyranids unit is within 9" of the bearer, that unit is within Synapse Range of your army.
enhancements.name: Synaptic Linchpin

enhancements.description: Tyranids model only. Once per turn, you can re-roll one Hit roll, one Wound roll, one Damage roll, one Advance roll, one Charge roll or one saving throw made for the bearer.
enhancements.name: Perfectly Adapted

enhancements.description: Tyranids model only. The bearer has the Feel No Pain 5+ ability. At the start of any turn, if the bearer has fewer than its starting number of wounds remaining, until the end of the battle, it has the Feel No Pain 4+ ability instead.
enhancements.name: Adaptive Biology

enhancements.description: Tyranids model only. After both players have deployed their armies, select up to three Tyranids units from your army and redeploy them. When doing so, you can set those units up in Strategic Reserves if you wish, regardless of how many units are already in Strategic Reserves.
enhancements.name: Alien Cunning

stratagems.effect:
Select one Hyper-adaptation.
Until the end of the battle round, that
hyper-adaptation is active for those
selected units in addition to any other that
may be active for your army.
stratagems.fluff:
Guided by the instincts of leader-beasts,
a portion of the swarm can be tasked with
focusing its hunting instincts to destroy a
particular foe.
stratagems.name: SYNAPTIC INSIGHT
stratagems.restrictions:
You cannot select the
same hyper-adaptation you selected at
the start of the first battle round.
stratagems.target:
Up to two Tyranids units from
your army that are within Synapse Range
of your army, or one other Tyranids unit
from your army.

stratagems.effect:
Until the end of the phase, each
time a model in your unit is destroyed, if
that model has not fought this phase, roll
one D6: on a 4+, do not remove it from
play. The destroyed model can fight after
the attacking modelâ€™s unit has finished
making attacks, and is then removed
from play
stratagems.fluff: Tyranids care nothing for selfpreservation, lashing out even in death.
stratagems.name: DEATH FRENZY
stratagems.target:
One Tyranids unit from your
army that was selected as the target of
one or more of the attacking unitâ€™s attacks.
stratagems.when:
Fight phase, just after an enemy
unit has selected its targets.

stratagems.effect:
Until the end of the phase,
each time a model in your unit makes a
Consolidation move, it can move up to
6" instead of up to 3", provided your unit
can end its Consolidation move in Unit
Coherency and within Engagement Range
of one or more enemy units. If your unit
is within Synapse Range of your army
and not within Engagement Range of
any enemy units, instead of making that
Consolidation move, it can instead make a
Normal move of up to 6".
stratagems.fluff:
Tyranids are an unstoppable avalanche of
flesh and chitin.
stratagems.name: OVERRUN
stratagems.when:
Fight phase, just before a Tyranids
unit from your army Consolidates.

stratagems.effect:
Until the end of the phase,
models in your unit have the
Feel No Pain 6+ ability. If your unit is
within Synapse Range of your army, until
the end of the phase, models in your unit
have the Feel No Pain 5+ ability instead.
stratagems.fluff:
Prey stare in horror as chitinous
armour regrows and flesh, muscle and
sinew knots back together as though
never harmed.
stratagems.name: RAPID REGENERATION
stratagems.target:
One Tyranids unit from your
army that was selected as the target of
one or more of the attacking unitâ€™s attacks.
stratagems.when:
Your opponentâ€™s Shooting phase or
the Fight phase, just after an enemy unit
has selected its targets.

stratagems.effect:
Up to D3+3 destroyed models are
returned to each of the selected units.
stratagems.fluff:
As the battle rages, more organisms pour
in to bolster the swarms.
stratagems.name: ENDLESS SWARM
stratagems.target:
Up to two Endless Multitude
units from your army that are within
Synapse Range of your army, or one other
Endless Multitude unit from your army.

stratagems.effect:
Until the end of the phase, each
time a model in one of those selected
units makes an attack, a successful
unmodified Hit roll of 5+ scores a
Critical Hit.
stratagems.fluff:
These warrior organisms destroy all as
their adrenaline surges.
stratagems.name: ADRENAL SURGE
stratagems.target:
Up to two Tyranids units from
your army that are within Synapse Range
of your army and are eligible to fight, or
one other Tyranids unit from your army
that is eligible to fight.
